Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus bud in added white outline; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: According to Cook and Woodhead, the writer of the inscription on this sherd is the same as on British Museum 1924,1201.768 and 1924,1201.770. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 121)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 725, no. 846)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1763) (phase 2)
